comments.raw_text:
We don't need the extra register as much on 64 bit and this will let us profile release builds.

I'll do a try build and see what impact it has on performance.
comments.creator: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com
comments.text:
We don't need the extra register as much on 64 bit and this will let us profile release builds.

I'll do a try build and see what impact it has on performance.
comments.author: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com
ted@mielczarek.org
comments.text: I can't imagine it's much of a perf hit given the glut of registers. We'd have to explicitly add -fno-omit-frame-pointer though, since omitting the frame pointer is the default.
comments.creator: ted@mielczarek.org
comments.raw_text: I can't imagine it's much of a perf hit given the glut of registers. We'd have to explicitly add -fno-omit-frame-pointer though, since omitting the frame pointer is the default.
There are a couple of regressions of about 5%. I'm not sure we want to take this or not. It would be interesting to compare the results when we switch to clang.
comments.author: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com
comments.text: There are a couple of regressions of about 5%. I'm not sure we want to take this or not. It would be interesting to compare the results when we switch to clang.
comments.creator: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com

comments.author: mstange.moz@gmail.com
comments.text: We've switched to clang in the meantime, we could try this again.
